context: The Estonian word 'võita' is a verb that means 'to win'. It can be used in various contexts such as winning games, competitions, money, or even abstract victories. In the infinitive form, it's one of the two infinitives in Estonian (the Da-infinitive). When conjugated, it appears as 'võitan' (I win), 'võidab' (he/she/it wins), and plural forms like 'meie võidame' (we win).
